title: Getting Started Examples
description: Practical examples to help you start your TypeScript journey

examples.title: Hello World
examples.explanation: We declare a constant with type 'string'. TypeScript ensures we only assign string values to it.

examples.title: Function with Types
examples.description: A function with typed parameters and return value
examples.explanation: The function explicitly states it takes two numbers and returns a number. TypeScript catches type mismatches at compile time.

examples.title: Object with Interface
examples.description: Defining the shape of an object
examples.explanation: An interface defines what properties an object must have. TypeScript ensures all required properties are present with correct types.

examples.title: Array with Type
examples.explanation: Typed arrays ensure all elements are of the same type. Array methods like map and forEach automatically know the element types.

examples.title: Type Inference in Action
examples.description: Let TypeScript figure out the types
examples.explanation: You don't always need to write types explicitly. TypeScript is smart enough to infer types from values and expressions.

examples.title: Minimal tsconfig.json
examples.description: A simple configuration to get started
examples.explanation: This configuration compiles TypeScript from 'src' folder to 'dist' folder with strict type checking enabled.

examples.title: package.json Scripts
examples.description: Common npm scripts for TypeScript projects
examples.explanation: These scripts automate common tasks. 'build' compiles your code, 'dev' recompiles on file changes, and 'start' runs the output.
